intro: Sphalmanthus viridiflorus, commonly known as the green-flowered sphalmanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow, and it produces pods that contain seeds. Sphalmanthus viridiflorus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in semi-arid to moist environments.
